Song.title: Hallelujah! What A Savior (Traditional)
Song.copyright: Words & Music by Phil­ip Bliss Public domain

Arrangement.text:
Verse 1: [G]Man of [D/F#]Sorrows! [Em]what a [B]name [C]For the [G]Son of [D]God, [A]who [D]came [G]Ruined [D/F#]sinners [Em]to [C]re[G]claim. [G]Hal[D/F#]le[Em]lu[D]jah! [Em]What a [C]Sa[G]vior!
Verse 2: [G]Bearing [D/F#]shame and [Em]scoffing [B]rude, [C]In my [G]place con[D]demned [A]He [D]stood; [G]Sealed my [D/F#]pardon [Em]with [C]His [G]blood. [G]Hal[D/F#]le[Em]lu[D]jah! [Em]What a [C]Sa[G]vior!
Verse 3: [G]Guilty, [D/F#]vile, and [Em]helpless [B]we; [C]Spotless [G]Lamb of [D]God [A]was [D]He; [G]Full a[D/F#]tonement! [Em]Can [C]it [G]be? [G]Hal[D/F#]le[Em]lu[D]jah! [Em]What a [C]Sa[G]vior!
Verse 4: [G]Lifted [D/F#]up was [Em]He to [B]die; [C]“It is [G]finished!” [D]was [A]His [D]cry; [G]Now in [D/F#]Heav’n e[Em]xal[C]ted [G]high. [G]Hal[D/F#]le[Em]lu[D]jah! [Em]What a [C]Sa[G]vior!
Verse 5: [G]When He [D/F#]comes, our [Em]glorious [B]King, [C]All His [G]ransomed [D]home [A]to [D]bring, [G]Then a[D/F#]new His [Em]song [C]we’ll [G]sing: [G]Hal[D/F#]le[Em]lu[D]jah! [Em]What a [C]Sa[G]vior!
Arrangement.searchtext: verse 1 man of sorrows what a name for the son of god who came ruined sinners to reclaim hallelujah what a savior verse 2 bearing shame and scoffing rude in my place condemned he stood sealed my pardon with his blood hallelujah what a savior verse 3 guilty vile and helpless we spotless lamb of god was he full atonement can it be hallelujah what a savior verse 4 lifted up was he to die it is finished was his cry now in heavn exalted high hallelujah what a savior verse 5 when he comes our glorious king all his ransomed home to bring then anew his song well sing hallelujah what a savior
